title: Technical Support Manager
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

**About the role:**
 Are you passionate about leading and coaching teams to deliver best in class customer experiences? We are looking for an inspiring leader to guide our EUROW Technical Support Team, a team of seven talented members, spread across Europe in our direct markets: (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Ireland, UK)
   

  

 As a
 **Technical Support Manager,** 
 you will be the voice and represent the interests of the Technical Support team, ensuring they provide best-in-class support to our users and prescribers.
   

  

 Together with EUROW Customer Service & Support Manager, you will develop and implement strategic plans and objectives to raise overall business value. While ensuring a great collaboration globally in our direct markets, you will build great relationships inside and outside the organization, including sales and logistics.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 This is an
 **onsite** 
 role in our Stockholm office.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Lead, Coach & Develop Your Team
* Oversee day-to-day case management, ensuring timely and accurate solutions.
* Ensure the team has sufficient technical knowledge for current and new products and planning ongoing training for the team.
* Conduct 1:1 meetings, team meetings, performance appraisals and salary reviews with team members.
* Nurture great collaborative culture in the team, promoting open and honest communication.
* Optimize Processes & Solve Problems
* Maintain and optimize procedures, processes, and systems to support the market globally.
* Ensure Technical Support global scalability and availability as we grow our markets.
* Build Relationships & Collaborate
* Act as escalation point for resolving Technical Support related issues.
* Collaborate with direct market regional managers to grow their markets.
* Work alongside Sales Operations to implement strategic plans.


**Please note:** 
 Our working hours are from 8:30am to 5:30pm.
   

  

**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for a proactive problem solver with a passion for improving processes and customer experiences:
   

  

* At least 1 year of experience in technical support and/or customer service is required.
* Previous team and/or operational leadership experience in tech support and/or customer service experience is high valued.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English are required. Proficiency in Norwegian or Swedish is a plus!
* Familiarity with Microsoft 365 tools.
* Experience with CRM systems is required (Salesforce, Dynamics 365 is a bonus).


**What is next?**
 Please share your questions at mine.hacisalihoglu@tobiidynavox.com and submit your resume and/or LinkedIn profile
 **(in English)** 
 through our career website. We look forward to your application!
   

  

**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Business and Solution Architect
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a highly skilled
 **Business and Solution Architect** 
 to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for investigating architectural needs, mapping dependencies, and understanding business drivers to effectively address our customers' requirements. You will collaborate with key stakeholders within
 **R&D** 
 Södertälje and contribute to defining optimal solutions for
 **R&D** 
 operations in China. Your work will also involve close coordination with teams in both Södertälje and China to ensure the seamless integration of architectural solutions for R&D Industrial Operations Asia.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Analyse architectural needs and requirements, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
* Map dependencies and business drivers to develop effective solutions.
* Work closely with responsible organizations within R&D.
* Contribute to defining and implementing solutions for R&D in China.
* Identify, create, and request architectural baselines to address end-user needs.
* Collaborate across global teams to align business and solution strategies.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English (spoken and written).
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a pragmatic approach to complex challenges.
* Ability to take initiative and work efficiently in fast-paced environments.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders.


**Why Join Us?**
 Vipas AB offers attractive employment packages for IT consultants, aligned with the Teknikföretagen (Almega) collective agreement. Clients Working with us provides opportunities in diverse industries, allowing you flexibility and growth. If you’re driven and eager to face new challenges, join the VIPAS family.
   

  

 You'll be part of an innovative team driving the future of telecom, Automotive, Retail, and Banking. If you're ready to take on challenging projects and grow your career in a cutting-edge environment, this is the opportunity for you!
   

  

 Apply Now & Please feel free to reach me at swathianantu@vipas.se &contact me at
   

  

 Note: Please do apply if you have Sweden PR/ citizenship OR a Sweden work permit.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by submitting their resume and cover letter. Join us in driving innovation in the VIPAS AB!
   

  

 Please note! We offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: VP Autonomous Vehicle
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.
   

  

**You will:**
* Be responsible for delivering our Heavy Duty Autonomous Vehicle including the Autonomous Drive sensor suite and Compute platform in time for testing and customer deployments
* Formalize technology roadmap together with your teams, with input from Product, Safety & Regulatory and Autonomous Drive Systems Engineering
* Lead the efforts of Vehicle & Chassis engineering, Manufacturing & Prototyping, Autonomous Drive Sensors & Compute and Autonomous Vehicle Program Management
* In partnership with Procurement explore, create and nurture strategic partnerships providing technology and other key-capabilities needed for a full eco-system of Autonomous Vehicle design, development and production.
* Be a member of the Autonomous Technologies Leadership Team delivering together the full Autonomous Transport Platform to Freight (Faas) and Technology (SaaS) customers


**We expect you to:**
* Business experience in managing strategic partnerships for vehicle development, sourcing, and innovation
* Extensive and proven track record of leading large-scale development of advanced vehicle technology, sensors, and computing systems
* Deep technical expertise in automotive engineering, vehicle architecture, and system integrations


 This is a full-time position based in Gothenburg or Stockholm. We recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible since selection and interviews are held continually.
   

  

 At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.
   

  

 Please note that as part of our standard recruitment process, we conduct a background control on the final candidate for this role. This may include verification of education, employment history, any relevant professional certifications or other information that may be of our interest.

title: Manager, System Administrator
description:
The Manager, System Administrator reports directly to Head of IT and is responsible for managing user accounts and ensuring system integrity across various platforms.
   

  

**Primary Responsibilities**
**User Account Management**
* Provision, de-provision, and modify user accounts (both internal and external) across a variety of platforms such as Veeva Vault, Trial Interactive eTMF and Simple Trials CTMS, as well as Microsoft 365/Entra AD.
* Address any user or vendor access issues promptly.
* Ensure access permissions and group memberships adhere to regulatory requirements and company policies.
* Identify opportunities to streamline and improve user account management processes, including implementing automation or best practices to enhance efficiency and compliance.


**System Maintenance**
* Conduct regular system periodic reviews to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, system integrity, and fitness for purpose.
* Implement preventative and improvement-focused maintenance to optimize availability and security.
* Coordinate with vendors for support, system integrations, and updates, ensuring adherence to GxP guidelines.
* Assist with system backups and updates.


**Documentation and Compliance**
* Create, review, and maintain detailed, audit-ready documentation for all user provisioning, system actions, and processes.
* Ensure IT systems comply with GxP regulations, company SOPs, and industry standards.
* Support audits by providing required documentation and resolving any identified gaps.


**Collaboration and Support**
* Partner with the Head of IT to identify and implement system improvements.
* Collaborate with ITB-MED departments to ensure efficient and secure access to all systems.
* Offer support for escalated user access issues and inquiries.
* Offer broad IT support to team members in both Sweden and the US.


**Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, IT, biotech, or a related field. Or equivalent relevant work experience.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in system administration in a regulated industry.
* Strong knowledge of IT security, access control strategies, and GxP documentation requirements.
* Experience with periodic system reviews and maintaining compliance documentation in a regulated industry.
* Ability to troubleshoot complex IT issues promptly and effectively.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Previous experience in the life sciences, pharmaceutical or other highly regulated industries.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Certifications related to Microsoft 365, Azure, Veeva Vault, or other relevant platforms.
* Bilingual proficiency in Swedish and English.


**What We Offer (Benefits)**
 Competitive pay and benefits such as
   

  

* Excellent healthcare and retirement plans and insurances with ability to exchange gross salary for pension
* Maximum annual wellness contribution
* Parental salary supplements
* Private health insurance and check-ups
* Inspiring facilities & environment working in our new combined lab & office space in “Forskaren”, Stockholm’s new life science centre


**Hiring Process**
 If your background and skills match the requirements for the position, you will be invited to complete a candidate assessment test. Following this, the hiring manager will contact you for an initial interview. As you progress further in the interview process, you may meet with the hiring manager as well as other key individuals. In the final stages, we will request references and your consent for background checks as part of our recruitment procedures.
   

  

 Applications will be processed as they come, so don’t hesitate to submit your application today. We are looking forward to your application!
   

  

***Disclosure***
*Please be aware that there are certain individuals and entities that fraudulently misrepresent to job seekers that ITB-MED has open employment positions when in fact those positions are not available* 
 .
   

  

*We do not recruit or offer positions via text messages, Signal, Facebook, WhatsApp, or any other messaging platforms.*
*ITB-MED does not ask you to send money and/or personal details such as banking information, passport and/or visa information. Should you think you have been a victim, please report the incident to legal(at)itb-med.com*
 ITB-MED, founded in 2016, has grown to over 40 employees across offices in Stockholm and New York. Clinical trials are being conducted globally, with a particular focus on the United States (US) and the European Union (EU), aiming to submit applications for the market authorization of siplizumab. We have expanded rapidly, and in 2024, our Swedish office relocated to a combined lab and office space in “Forskaren,” Stockholm’s new life science center.

title: Teknisk projektledare inom infrastruktur
description:
Vill du vara med och driva utveckling av Skandias infrastruktur tillsammans med våra team inom Tech? Som teknisk projektledare inom vårt infrastrukturområde kommer du agera som en Epic Owner. Du leder både stora som små förändringsinitiativ inom området i nära samverkan med övrig IT, leverantörer samt Skandias affär. Är du redo för utmaningen? Sök denna roll redan idag!
   

  

**Att jobba som teknisk projektledare inom infrastruktur**
 I rollen som teknisk projektledare inom infrastruktur är du en del av tågledningen i vårt lean-agila releasetåg tech och rapporterar direkt till chefen för IT gemensamt. Tågledningen består idag av fyra personer: produktledare, RTE och två domänarkitekter där du kommer att ingå. Tillsammans driver tågledningen arbetet med att utveckla Skandias infrastruktur framåt.
   

  

 Eftersom tech, som infrastrukturtåg, ofta själv äger och driver utvecklingsinitiativen innebär det att du i din ledarroll stöttar tågets produktledare och självständigt driver ett brett spektrum av uppgifter. En viktig del i rollen är att driva stora komplexa förflyttningar och utvecklingsinitiativ som spänner över lång tid. I rollen kommer du parallellt med detta även leda mindre omfattande förändringsaktiviteter. Utöver detta verka som mentor för andra inom tåget.
   

  

 En viktig del av rollen, oavsett storlek på förändringsarbetet, är att hantera kommunikation med Skandias utvecklingståg och team samt med externa intressenter.
   

  

 Arbetet sker hybrid vilket innebär i dagsläget minst tre dagar i veckan på vårt kontor vid Lindhagensgatan 86.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Du är flexibel, prestiglös och har en vilja att växla mellan stora och små uppgifter. Som person är du lösningsorienterad, kommunikativ och tar ansvar för sitt arbete själv samt i grupp.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har mångårig erfarenhet av att driva infrastrukturnära utvecklingsprojekt inom IT. Har arbetat med agila metoder, gärna inom SAFe. Du har ett starkt intresse för infrastruktur, från driftslösningar till leverantörsdialoger. Samtidigt innehar du en förmåga att samarbeta med olika grupper på olika nivåer, inklusive ledningsgrupper. Som person har du en god förståelse för affärsbehov och kan vara ett stöd i dialogen mellan behov och lösning. Du behärskar svenska flytande i både tal och skrift.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen kompetensbaserad kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester via Alva Labs, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om rollen vänligen ta kontakt med lena.nilssonbaeckman@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till vår rekryteringsprocessen vänligen ta kontakt med harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: SAP Demand to Supply
description:
*Capgemini's Nordic SAP team continues to grow successfully, with new initiatives and big, exciting ambitions. Our SAP capability operates across both public and private sectors such as retail, manufacturing, automotive, pharmacy, utilities and ­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­defense. We contribute to the success of our clients by taking responsibility for their challenging SAP transformation journeys. As our S/4 project portfolio is growing, so is our need for talented SAP consultants.*
 We are currently seeking experienced
 **SAP Consultants** 
 to join us! As an SAP Consultant, you will be responsible for optimizing end-to-end processes through SAP S4 HANA, helping us improve efficiency, reduce costs, and deliver superior customer service. If you have a track record of implementing and supporting SAP solutions and are a true Team Player that is passionate about adding value to clients and want to advance your career, this could be the role for you!
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
* Lead the design, configuration, and implementation of SAP S/4HANA, ensuring it aligns with business requirements and best practices.
* Provide strategic advice and expertise to clients on SAP S/4HANA Integrated Business Planning (IBP), Production Planning and Detailed Scheduling (PP/DS), Manufacturing (PP), Digital Manufacturing (DM), Extended Warehouse Management (EWM), Transportation Management (TM), Quality Management (QM) and Enterprise Asset Management (EAM/PM).
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate with other SAP functional areas and external systems.
* Lead, Guide and Support junior consultants, fostering their professional growth and ensuring high-quality project delivery.
* Stay updated with industry trends and the latest developments in SAP S/4HANA and emerging technologies to continuously enhance service delivery.


**YOUR PROFILE**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Supply Chain Management, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related fields.
* Proven experience as an SAP Consultant, with at least 5 years of hands-on experience.
* Proven track record in implementing and supporting SAP Solutions in a complex environment.
* Strong understanding of Supply Chain Management processes and best practices.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.
* SAP certification in relevant area.
* Experience in a minimum of one S/4 transformation.
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Fluency in English; proficiency in Swedish is preferred.
* Nordic-based and open to travel.


**APPLICATION**
 Does this sound like the right challenge for you? Apply Now and Transform Your Career with Capgemini!
   

  

 We review applications on an ongoing basis and look forward to hearing from you. The recruitment process includes an interview with the hiring manager, a content interview, a logic test, a personality test and reference taking.
   

  

**About Us**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries.
   

  

 With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
   

  

 Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Javautvecklare till IT-konsultbolag i tillväxt!
description:
**Är du vår nästa Javautvecklare?**
 Har ett stort intresse för Javautveckling och söker en roll i ett företag där gemenskap och generositet står i centrum? Då kan du vara den vi letar efter!
   

  

 På SysPartner erbjuder vi en utmanande och dynamisk roll som Javautvecklare, där du får möjlighet att arbeta med de senaste teknologierna och delta i spännande projekt hos våra kunder, som varierar från medelstora till stora företag.
   

  

**Om rollen som Javautvecklare**
 Som Javautvecklare på SysPartner kommer du att ha en central roll i våra utvecklingsprojekt. Ditt arbete kommer att innefatta utveckling av Java-applikationer och -system, samt nära samarbete med kunder för att förstå deras behov och erbjuda skräddarsydda lösningar.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Högskole- eller Civilingenjörsexamen inom relevant område
* Minst 9 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling
* Gedigen kunskap i Java och relaterade teknologier som Spring och Hibernate
* Erfarenhet av arbete med databaser och SQL
* Erfarenhet av API-utveckling och integration


 Befattningen kan komma att kräva att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tids gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där krav finns på säkerhetsklassinplacering, kan i förekommande fall, medföras krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

**Meriterande erfarenhet**
* Erfarenhet av molntjänster som AWS eller Azure
* Kunskap i kontinuerlig integration och leverans (CI/CD)
* Erfarenhet av Docker och Kubernetes för containerbaserad utveckling och orkestrering
* Kunskap om webbaserad utveckling och moderna ramverk som Angular eller React är ett plus.


**Din Profil**
 Du har ett brinnande intresse för kodning och teknik. Du är initiativrik, en lagspelare och bidrar med positiv energi till teamet. Du trivs med nya utmaningar och har en analytisk förmåga samt systematiskt arbetssätt. Du har också förmåga att arbeta såväl självständigt som i team.
   

  

**Vilka är SysPartner?**
 SysPartner, grundat i Linköping 2005 och med kontor i Stockholm, Västerås och Luleå, är experter inom systemutveckling och IT-infrastruktur. Vi förenar en familjär företagskultur med spännande och utmanande uppdrag hos våra kunder, och lägger stor vikt vid varje medarbetares personliga bidrag och delaktighet. Vi värdesätter det lilla företagets familjära känsla, samtidigt som vi ger våra konsulter möjlighet att arbeta i större projekt hos våra kunder. Hos oss är personliga egenskaper och bidrag till företagskulturen av stor betydelse. Vi uppmuntrar att ta med personliga intressen till arbetet och erbjuder generösa personalförmåner samt en mängd sociala aktiviteter.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Om du känner att denna roll passar dig, skicka in din ansökan redan idag, via vårt rekryteringssystem. Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt team och tillsammans fortsätta vår framgångsresa!

title: Head of Program Office
description:
Grow with us
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 RAN Software & Compute Platforms Engineering (RCE) is a new unit with end-to-end responsibilities for software and compute, focusing on next-gen development for open and cloud-native RAN software. With high-performing programmable networks, enabled by openness and cloud, the unit will help Ericsson to maintain technology leadership.
   

  

 Business Operations and Program Office seeks to drive that RCE has the best people, the best practices and operating model, to deliver the best product that meets our customers' needs through quality focused execution within our portfolio financial investments.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* The Program Office unit enables RCE to translate the strategic directions into operational reality securing customer value short, mid, and long term.
* Drive large and complex assignments, spanning multiple PEUs/FUs.
* Lead, coach and align organization to effectively execute and satisfy customer needs for EU RCE and BNEW.
* Design, prepare and secure program-setup for future, large and complex assignments, e.g. 6G
* Empower and enhance the project management community through active coaching and skills development.
* Develop and refine a structured framework that drives efficiency, transparency, and predictability in our programs, driving continuous improvement and success.


**The skills you bring:**
* Domain experience in program management
* Ability to drive timely execution against roadmap
* 10+ years product development experience in leading global large development teams, with a demonstrated passion for development
* Strong domain knowledge to have the needed credibility with our teams and suppliers
* Experience driving transformation in R&D organizations
* Relevant tertiary qualification or commensurate working experience.
* Strategic and big picture thinking, with the ability to focus on delivering on your contribution to BNEW R&D today and into the future
* Thrives on accountability, overcoming challenges with a can-do attitude and motivated to achieve beyond expectations
* Collaborates by default and looks to work together rather than compete, also holding your teams accountable for working as one BNEW R&D
* Authentic, courageous and inspiring leadership with empathy and humanness, whilst building high performing teams and growing tomorrow’s leaders
* Fact-based and timely decisions, stepping forward to make tough decisions even when paradoxes are present, details lacking, or the stakes are high
* Customer-first mindset and proactively build this in your team.
* Action oriented, solution focused and collaborative leader


**Note: Security clearance including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates.**
**Last date to apply: 17th March 2025**
**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 762368
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 Versha Sharma (versha.sharma@ericsson.com)
   

  

 ]]>

title: Director of Customer & Partner Success
description:
Auctionet is a marketplace where auction houses from Sweden, the UK, Finland, Spain, Germany, and Denmark sell furniture, art, design items, collectibles, and more. We are now looking for a
 **Director of Customer & Partner Success** 
 to lead our
 **Customer Support Team** 
 and
 **Partner Success Team** 
 —ensuring outstanding service for our customers and driving growth for our auction house partners.
   

  

**About The Work**
 As Customer & Partner Success Leader, you will lead two teams:
   

  

* Customer Support Team (12 people) – Handling customer inquiries, ensuring excellent service, and continuously improving the customer experience. To ensure we offer world-class customer service! Some of us work part-time while others are full-time employees in our Customer Support Team.
* Partner Success Team (5 people) – Strategically supporting and developing our auction house partners, enabling their growth through data-driven insights, KPIs, and strategic guidance together with our Head of Partner Success. We have around 80 auction houses today that are split within the team, a team that was just formed in January 2025.


 Your role is crucial in ensuring that our customers feel valued and supported while helping our partners grow their business with Auctionet. Your work will directly impact the success of Auctionet, making it easier for auction houses to thrive and for customers to enjoy a seamless auction experience. All while empowering a world-class team that will enable us to be the best customer service in the industry.
   

  

**Examples Of What You’ll Work On**
* Enhance customer satisfaction by optimizing efficient processes for handling inquiries and issues.
* Lead and inspire a team of 17 to be their best at work.
* Optimize partner support by providing insights, tools, and guidance that help auction houses grow their business.
* Develop KPIs and tracking methods to measure success and improve performance.
* Improve workflows by identifying bottlenecks and implementing solutions to enhance efficiency.
* Collaborate with Product & Tech, Transport, Finance, Marketing and other departments to develop new tools that improve customer and partner interactions.
* Work with LEAN and ensure a seamless journey for our customers and partners.


**About The Team**
 We are two engaged and knowledgeable teams that value collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement. We work closely with colleagues across Auctionet to ensure our platform is the best place for both customers and auction houses. Our work environment is flexible and dynamic, and we encourage ideas that challenge the status quo.
   

  

**About You**
 We believe you are an experienced leader with a passion for customer experience, operational efficiency, and partner success. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy working both strategically and hands-on, with a passion for building great teams.
   

  

 You’ll be based in Stockholm, since both teams rely on close collaboration with other departments, we believe being present at the office regularly will enhance communication and efficiency, and enable more moments of magic.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* Proven experience in customer success, partner success, or customer support leadership.
* Strong ability to build and develop high-performing teams.
* Analytical and data-driven mindset, comfortable working with KPIs and performance metrics.
* Confident in Fresh Desk or similar CRM systems.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and excellent English.
* A problem-solver who thrives in a dynamic and evolving environment.
* Experience in e-commerce, marketplace, or SaaS industries is a plus.


**About Us**
 Auctionet.com is one of Europe's leading marketplaces for art, design, furniture and antiques and brings together over 80 auction houses from Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Great Britain, Germany, and Spain. We are a close-knit, international team with many years of experience in the auction industry.
   

  

 We currently have approximately 170 employees and our headquarters is located near Stureplan in central Stockholm. Our logistics centers are located in Malmö, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Westbury and Cologne.
   

  

 Still hesitant why to apply?
   

  

 Here are our top five reasons why you should join us:
   

  

 ✅ A high-impact role where your work will truly shape customer and partner success.
   

  

 ✅ A growing international company with a strong market position.
   

  

 ✅ A collaborative and innovative work culture.
   

  

 ✅ Opportunities for personal and professional growth.
   

  

 ✅ A smart, fun, and friendly team with a sustainable business idea.
   

  

 Interviews take place continuously, so don't wait to apply to us.
   

  

 We are really looking forward to receiving your application!

title: Teknisk systemförvaltare Windows server
description:
*Vill du bidra med dina Windows-kunskaper på en myndighet där du gör verklig skillnad för Sveriges säkerhet? Då kan FOI vara din nya arbetsplats! Vi erbjuder ett arbetsliv i balans, en utvecklande arbetsmiljö och ett samhällsviktigt arbete!*
**Om tjänsten**
 I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår operativ drift och förvaltning samt utveckling av plattformarna inom området. Detta i samarbete med resten av teamet. Arbetsuppgifterna innebär även att vara delaktig i uppdrag och jobba för att säkerställa en kvalitativ driftmiljö. Du får stor möjlighet att påverka utvecklingen av plattformen.
   

  

 Denna tjänst är placerad i Kista där du blir en del av en dedikerad Windowsgrupp som kompletterar varandra kunskapsmässigt och samarbetar nära varandra i det dagliga arbetet. IT-plattformen består till ca 80 procent av Windows och 20 procent Linux fördelat på drygt 1000 användare.
   

  

  

**Om enheten**
 FOI finns på fyra platser: Stockholm-Kista, Umeå, Stockholm-Grindsjön och Linköping. Som teknisk systemförvaltare kommer du vara en del av FOI:s IT-enhet. IT-enheten består av 45 medarbetare och vi räknar med att växa kraftigt de kommande åren. Medarbetarna finns på alla myndighetens fyra orter, de flesta i Kista. IT-enheten ingår i avdelningen Forskningsstöd som ansvarar för att strategiskt planera, driva och operativt genomföra myndighetsövergripande och verksamhetsgemensamma uppgifter inom avdelningens kompetensområden. På avdelningen återfinns myndighetens verksamheter gällande juridik, inköp, redovisning, kommunikation, IT, personal och fastighet. På avdelningen finns även myndighetens funktioner för till exempel arkiv, bibliotek, rapportadministration, registratur, resor, tryckeri samt miljöfrågor. Läs gärna mer om vad avdelningen gör genom att klicka på länken: Forskningsstöd
   

  

  

**Har du den kompetensprofil vi behöver?**
**Krav**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* En för tjänsten relevant utbildning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom Windows Server 2016-2022
* Djup teknisk kompetens inom området
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Som person är du självgående och tar egna initiativ samt eget ansvar för området. Du har god problemlösningsförmåga vilket gör att du effektivt kan identifiera och lösa tekniska utmaningar. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper!
   

  

  

**Meriterande**
**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Arbetat i en blandad IT-miljö med Linux och Windows
* Erfarenhet av scripting med Powershell
* Erfarenhet av Active Directory
* Erfarenhet av GPO
* Erfarenhet av automatiserad hantering, provisionering och moderna driftslösningar
* Kunskaper i övriga angränsande teknikområden som FOI bedömer som relevanta för tjänsten
* Arbetat inom försvarssektorn


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Totalförsvarets forskningsinstitut (FOI) är en statlig myndighet som bedriver världsledande forskning inom försvar och säkerhet till stöd för Sveriges militära och civila försvar. Vi erbjuder en unik arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att arbeta med det som är viktigt för totalförsvaret och hela samhället. Forskningen tillämpas både inom försvarsmyndigheter och hos civila aktörer och spelar en avgörande roll i att bygga en relevant och effektiv försvarsförmåga.
   

  

 Vi arbetar medvetet för en god arbetsmiljö med en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Utöver detta erbjuder vi en rad förmåner. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: https://www.foi.se/jobba-hos-oss.html
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

  

**Vill du vara med och söka svaren för en säkrare värld?**
 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och personligt brev via ansökningsknappen senast den 30 mars!
   

  

 För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta sektionschef Daniel Åkerstedt. Fackliga företrädare är Fredrik Ringblom (Saco-S) och Jonas Svefors (OFR/S – ST) Samtliga nås på 08-555 030 00.
   

  

 Då anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). Inför säkerhetsprövning efterfrågas vidimerade kopior på de utbildningar och tjänstgöringsintyg som är relevanta för tjänsten.
   

  

 FOI är en myndighet varmed inlämnade ansökningshandlingar blir allmän handling som på begäran kan lämnas ut till utomstående enligt offentlighets- och sekretesslagen.
   

  

 Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag undanbedes.

title: Director, IT Strategy Consulting, SAP
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
**Role title:** 
 Director SAP, Consulting
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**About The Role**
 Gartner Consulting see a growing demand for advanced independent advice in SAP domain and are looking for seasoned individual to join our Nordic & European team. The role is expected to deliver services across the end-to-end SAP strategy and implementation lifecycle, building practice capability to drive accelerated client value and impact across public sector and commercial industries . The successful candidate will enhance the ERP / SAP capability alongside a focused team of SAP experts who are seeking to empower our clients' capabilities across the Nordic and EMEA region.
   

  

 Our objective is to deliver increased value to our clients beyond strategy development and towards transformational value realisation. Therefore, the successful candidate will proactively seek opportunities to develop and mature the Enterprise Applications consulting service with a focus on SAP which will also include SAP strategy, assurance, programme management and architecture definition.
   

  

 We seek candidates who have strong and recent experience of delivering end-to-end ERP / SAP transformation programmes from an initial strategic assessment, target definition and business case through implementation and go-live for large and global enterprises.
   

  

 The candidate will be self-motivated and willing to drive the maturity of the Gartner Enterprise Applications capability including;
   

  

* Identification of enhanced capability growth opportunities.
* Developing go to market plans and execution thereof.
* Enhancing approaches / methodologies and tooling to accelerate client impact as well as leveraging Gartner research where suitable.
* Providing key deliverable quality assurance.


**What you’ll need:**
*Consulting Experience in Practice & Capability Development:*
* Extensive client-facing consulting experience ideally from a tier 1 consultancy
* Excellent executive communication skills at CxO level.
* Willingness to develop strategic analysis and presentations for clients with the support of concise capable teams using Powerpoint presentation.
* Good knowledge of competitor services offerings in SAP Strategic advisory, Implementation and Assurance.
* Experience leading or willingness to contribute to the development of an existing SAP capability - maturing and refining the existing SAP service offering including the activities, and deliverables to provide strategic as-is assessment and target state definition, and implementation roadmap
* Willingness to work with clients across EMEA (limited travel).
* Eligible for Swedish Security Clearance
* Must be fluent in Swedish language


 In addition, you will ideally be experienced in both pre-sales and implementation work. However, if your skillset focusses on one more than the other, please do not hesitate to apply. In particular, the following experience would be valuable:
   

  

*Presales:*
* Strategic assessments and direction setting for customers, including current state assessment, strategic optioneering, and target state definition.
* Business case development for S/4HANA.
* Programme definition and planning / roadmapping.
* Implementation costing / estimation.
* Solution Integrator contracting / contract assessments.


*Implementation:*
* Prior experience in a “techno-functional” role and currently working within SAP programme management or SAP Enterprise Architecture.
* Experience of delivering multiple E2E implementations across Large Enterprise SAP projects from strategy to delivery.
* Senior or leadership role in 2+ large migrations to S/4 HANA.
* Good understanding of the process and activities required, as well as knowledge of how to baseline the existing SAP / ERP solutions, and plan for a transition to an S/4 HANA-enabled target-state.
* Awareness of different ERP solutions and common approaches for strategy development / assessment (using Gartner research as an additional source).


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:83178
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Senior IT Analyst, eBridge, Payments Integration
description:
**Job ID: 27569**
 Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.
   

  

 Would you like to work in an international team of IT professionals with a long experience in enterprise file transfer services and business processes? We are now looking for a Senior IT Analyst to manage and develop our B2B integration platform, working closely with other IT teams and business stakeholders. At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So, bring your skills, ideas, and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.
   

  

 You’ll join a multinational team of professionals that have fun at work. The role is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We’re not just a bank; we’re a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 Welcome to the E-Bridge team. We add value by providing file transfer services for our corporate customers and internal partners. As the Senior IT Analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in providing high quality, business critical and reliable service.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
* Collaborating with multiple stakeholders in alignment with the target picture to enable sustainable solutions
* Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by cooperating with different stakeholders
* Securing requirements traceability during smooth end-to-end development
* Being responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
* Supporting testers and developers in the team.


**Who You Are**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, we believe that you are s elf-driven, communicative, team player with good understanding of critical enterprise environments and importance of operational stability. Able to stay calm, focused and work rational under pressure.
   

  

**You have as well knowledge/skills within:**
* 5+ years of experience with SEEBURGER Business Integration Suite
* Experience as requirement specialist in the Payment area. SEPA, Swift and ISO messages. File types XML, CSV, Inhouse, Edifact
* Technical knowledge and experience of communication and file transfer protocols: SFTP, FTPS, HTTPS
* Experience on Seeburger multiple Tools (BIS FE, Portal 7, Mapping Designer, BISMD/Developer Studio)
* Worked on Seeburger 6.7 applications
* Experience in different language understanding for creating mapping documents: Java, Cobol, Linux
* Experience in Data Mapping, flows, Migration, and Process Modelling
* Understanding of databases and basic SQL skills
* Experience of B2B integration


**Your background and skills include:**
* IT analysis skills. Strong knowledge of payment systems and domain
* Experience with integration software on-premise, hybrid or as a cloud solution service
* Strong technical knowledge User Interface - prototyping and design
* Identifies people and systems impacted by functional and non-functional requirements Assists in development and quality control activities
* Details the Business/IT Requirements and creates Requirements Specification Document (functional and non-functional)


**Nice to have:**
* Knowledge of file messages/filetypes used in banking sector
* Knowledge of additional protocols: SWIFT, MQ
* Knowledge of Webservice


**What We Offer**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

 People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
**that fosters performance and growth** 
 in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next Steps**
 Submit your application no later than 31/03/2025. For more information, you are welcome to contact Ricardo Lima (Ricardo.Lima@nordea.com) for this opportunity related queries and Ritu Mittal ( ritu.mittal@consult.nordea.com ) for HR related matters.
   

  

**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

**For candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Head of Operations
description:
Grow with us
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 RAN Software & Compute Platforms Engineering (RCE) is a new unit with end-to-end responsibilities for software and compute, focusing on next-gen development for open and cloud-native RAN software. With high-performing programmable networks, enabled by openness and cloud, the unit will help Ericsson to maintain technology leadership.
   

  

 Business Operations and Program Office seeks to drive that RCE has the best people, the best practices and operating model, to deliver the best product that meets our customers' needs through quality focused execution within our portfolio financial investments.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* The Operations unit provides framework and services for operational excellence. Striving to achieve greater effectiveness & efficiency by developing, improving, reinforcing processes, structures, tools and in parallel securing compliance to Ericsson Group Functions and corporate directives.
* Lead the RCE Framework & governance for Process and WoW incl. improvements & access/tools (JIRA, MHWEB, Eridoc)
* Manage Operational tools (JIRA, FPT, Eridoc) and ensure they meet the needs of the organization
* Develop and enhance measurement dashboards for Programs to enable continuous efficiency and productivity improvements.
* Implement and lead robust risk management and impediment handling framework within RCE
* Manage RCE Information and internal communication (SharePoint, web mgmt.)
* Lead Assessments & Audits (internal & external)
* Drive Compliance in areas of: EGMS, Business Continuity, ISMS & Privacy coordination
* Oversee BNEW R&D responsibilities for Management system compliance, Business continuity, Information & access mgt.


**The skills you bring:**
* Domain experience in Operations of large-scale organizations
* Ability to drive timely execution
* 10+ years product development experience in leading global large development teams, with a demonstrated passion for development
* Strong domain knowledge to have the needed credibility with our teams and suppliers
* Experience driving transformation in R&D organizations
* Experience in developing and leading operations tools and services
* Relevant tertiary qualification or commensurate working experience.
* Strategic and big picture thinking, with the ability to focus on delivering on your contribution to BNEW R&D today and into the future
* Thrives on accountability, overcoming challenges with a can-do attitude and motivated to achieve beyond expectations
* Collaborates by default and looks to work together rather than compete, also holding your teams accountable for working as one BNEW R&D
* Authentic, courageous and inspiring leadership with empathy and humanness, whilst building high performing teams and growing tomorrow’s leaders
* Fact-based and timely decisions, stepping forward to make tough decisions even when paradoxes are present, details lacking, or the stakes are high
* Customer-first mindset and proactively build this in your team.
* Action oriented, solution focused and collaborative leader
* Passionate about driving operational effectiveness and fostering a collaborative culture


**Note: Security clearance including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates.**
**Last date to apply: 17th March 2025**
**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Sweden (SE) or Ottawa, Canada
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 762621
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 Versha Sharma( versha.sharma@ericsson.com)

title: Sr. Solutions Architect Enterprise
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
   

  

 Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Sweden and empower large enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
   

  

 Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.
   

  

 They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customer's validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, Industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.
   

  

 Amongst others you will be part of design and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and deploy production workloads on AWS. Provide thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernization and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

**About The Team**
 iverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Background in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps across industries.
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience
* Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
* English business level communication skills written and verbal


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prior domain experience in enterprise cloud adoption and operating production workloads on AWS
* Knowledge of cloud native design patterns, DevOps practices and AWS services
* Experience with or understanding of common enterprise regulations, security and compliance standards
* Public speaking experience or passion for creating technical content


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2902217

title: IT Procurement & Vendor Manager ICA Sverige
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
*Du som kan IT-inköp, har hanterat kommersiella och legala förhandlingar och dessutom har en insikt hur IT kan ge effekt på sista raden är varmt välkommen att söka en roll till vårt team på IT Procurement & Vendor Management inom ICA Sverige. Vårt ansvar är att driva upphandlingar och omförhandlingar av IT-relaterade produkter och tjänster.*
*Vi arbetar strukturerat med IT-leverantörsstyrning och IT-inköp för alla affärsområden inom ICA Sverige och stöttar även andra dotterbolag inom ICA-koncernen. Vi har höga ambitioner och en stark förändrings- och utvecklingsvilja och vill därför rekrytera dig som brinner för att utveckla både dig själv och ICA inom IT Procurement & Vendor Management.*
**Om jobbet**
 IT Procurement & Vendor Manager ansvarar primärt för att helheten med strategiska leverantörer och leveransen enligt avtal fungerar. I detta ingår bland annat att utveckla och ta fram upphandlingsunderlag, leda upphandlingar, förhandla och omförhandla avtal, ansvara för leverantörsstyrning, hantera leverantörs- och beställarkontakter samt flera andra delar inom den dagliga driften av vår verksamhet. Du är även med och utvecklar våra processer och arbetssätt för att möta verksamhetens behov.
   

  

 Du kommer även ansvara för att samordna såväl interna som externa intressenter inom olika inköpsområden, i syfte att identifiera och implementera kostnadseffektiva leverantörs- och kategoristrategier. Du har ett tätt samarbete med personer inom olika delar av organisationen, beroende på vilket behov som uppstår. Du agerar alltid professionellt och har lätt för att samarbeta med såväl IT-avdelningen som leverantörers mest seniora motparter.
   

  

 Du har en genuin passion för bra affärer och vågar utmana gamla mönster. Du bidrar till att skapa förutsättningar för en smidig process där vi stöttar verksamheten att få bästa möjliga tjänster till bästa möjliga villkor på lång och kort sikt. Du kommer att ha en hög grad av självständighet och frihet att lägga upp ditt arbete som det fungerar för dig och dem du arbetar med. Vi i teamet uppskattar inkludering, laganda, och samarbete, och ser gärna att du trivs i en sådan miljö.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 Vi söker en IT-inköpare med 2-5 års erfarenhet, som bör kunna driva strategiska upphandlingar självständigt och ha vana av att skriva, förhandla och tolka avtalstexter. Vi har även krav på att kunna tala och skriva på svenska och engelska obehindrat. Vi ser gärna att du har som ambition att bidra till att utveckla IT Procurement & Vendor Management-funktionen inom ICA tillsammans med övriga kollegor i teamet.
   

  

 Vad händer nu?
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Johan Aaro, 072-220 02 56. Urval sker löpande och sista dag att visa intresse är 2025-04-11.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

*ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Tester kan förekomma i processen. Vi värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med mål om helt rökfria arbetsplatser och tillämpar även drogtestning i samband med rekryteringen.*
 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.

title: Leverantörsansvarig
description:
*Är du en erfaren och driven person med en passion för leverantörshantering? Vill du vara en del av ett engagerat team som stöttar hela bolaget med rådgivning inom olika sakområden? Då kan rollen som Leverantörsansvarig hos oss vara din nästa utmaning!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som Leverantörsansvarig kommer du att spela en central roll i vår organisation genom att säkerställa hög leveranskvalitet och kostnadseffektivitet. Du kommer att arbeta både självständigt och i nära samarbete med affärsområdesansvariga, jurister och inköpsavdelningen samt outsourcingfunktionen. Rollen innebär att du kommer att utveckla och förvalta arbetssätt och processer för leverantörsstyrning, samt stödja organisationen med instruktioner och utbildning. Du kommer att ha breda kontaktytor både externt som inom bolaget/koncernen.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Följa upp leveranskvalitet och säkerställa bästa möjliga leverans och kostnadseffektivitet i nära samarbete med affärsområdesansvariga.
* Stort ansvar för IT-utläggning till moderbolaget LF Bank
* Etablera och förvalta ett arbetssätt gentemot outsourcingfunktionen
* Etablera uppföljning och kontrollmekanismer för den operativa styrningen samt stödja organisationen med instruktioner och utbildning


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta mycket med leverantörer och uppföljning av leverans, särskilt gentemot IT-leverantörer
* Erfarenhet från bank/finans och god insyn i relevanta regelverk avseende leverantörshantering
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Kompetens kring DORA och outsourcingregelverk


 Som person har du hunnit skaffa dig en trygghet inom olika typer av leverantörssamarbeten, men har ett starkt driv att utvecklas och gå vidare för att utveckla den operativa funktionen och skaffa bra kontaktvägar. Du är van att arbeta självständigt och har förhandlingsvana. Du är affärsmässig och pragmatisk utan att släppa kravet på hög kvalitet i ditt arbete. Du arbetar strukturerat och är trygg med att fatta beslut. Du är driven och engagerad, kommunikativ, har lätt att etablera relationer och tycker om att ge service. Du är en lagspelare och har mycket lätt för att samarbeta.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Avdelningen Stab består av åtta drivna medarbetare som fokuserar på att stötta hela bolaget med rådgivning inom olika sakområden. Leverantörsansvarig är en ny etablering av roll inom bolaget och avdelningen. Vi välkomnar dig till ett team som är högt uppskattat på bolaget, framför allt för att vi alltid är affärsnära i vår rådgivning. I min chefsroll finns jag till för dig och stöttar dig i ditt arbete. Jag kommer även vara mycket kommunikativ och förlitar mig på att du kan arbeta under eget ansvar.
   

  

 Wasa Kredit är ett personligt finansbolag med kunden i fokus och en familjär arbetskultur som värdesätter hälsa, mångfald och hållbarhet. Vi erbjuder en trygg arbetsmiljö med möjlighet att påverka och utvecklas. Som dotterbolag till Länsförsäkringar Bank har vi över 240 engagerade medarbetare och kännetecknas av en varm atmosfär och snabba beslutsvägar. Hos oss blir du en del av något större, där trivsel och arbetsglädje är viktigt.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-28**

title: SAP-konsult, Stockholm
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Känner du dig nyfiken på nya utmaningar? Vill du jobba på en flexibel arbetsplats med spännande uppdrag inom SAP?
   

  

 Nu söker vi erfarna SAP-konsulter till vårt team i Stockholm, som är en del av vår nationella SAP Practice där vi jobbar tillsammans med SAP i fokus. Nu sker en renässans inom SAP med SAP S/4HANA, SAP Business Technology Platform, Embedded Analytics med mera. Det innebär att företag som använder SAP står inför helt nya utmaningar och möjligheter. Vill du vara med på denna resa?
   

  

 Välkommen till oss på CGI!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I rollen som SAP-konsult får du möjlighet att vara en viktig kugge i CGI:s leverans gentemot uppdragsgivare där du ingår i ett team med kunniga och erfarna kollegor. Här får du möjlighet att hjälpa våra kunder att effektivisera och utveckla sina affärsprocesser och systemlösningar med hjälp av de möjligheter SAP som affärssystem ger.
   

  

 Våra uppdrag finns inom till exempel ECC, CRM, S/4HANA, S/4HANA Cloud, SuccessFactors och User Experience. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta inom såväl implementationsprojekt, processförbättringar och förvaltningsuppdrag inom olika branscher så som Insurance, Retail och Manufacturing.
   

  

 Våra kunder befinner sig på olika stadier i sina resor mot S/4HANA. En del befinner sig redan i den nya tekniken, några har en pågående förändringsresa och andra har ännu inte tagit steget till den nya SAP-plattformen. Här kommer du spela en viktig roll i att guida våra kunder i deras förändringsresa.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som redan är SAP-konsult eller har arbetat som SAP key user, och i rollen deltagit i eller drivit utvecklings- eller förändringsprojekt. Om du inte redan har arbetat med S/4HANA är det viktigt att du är nyfiken på det och vill göra en kompetensresa.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har följande:
   

  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande
* Svenska och engelska obehindrad i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet eller ett brinnande intresse för ett eller flera av följande områden:
   

  

* Masterdata
* Finance
* Plan
* Source
* Make
* Deliver
* Security
* Analytics
* Technology
* ABAP
* Business Tech Platform (BTP)
* Integration, SAP Cloud Platform Intergration (CPI)
* RPA
* Machine learning
* User Experience (Fiori, Neptune)


**Mer information om tjänsten**
 För den här rollen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Rollen som konsult innebär en omväxlande vardag där du behöver ha en förmåga och drivkraft att bygga och utveckla goda relationer för att skapa ett starkt samarbete. För att framgångsrikt kunna lösa utmaningar som du och ditt team ställs inför söker vi dig med ett analytiskt tänk och kreativ problemlösningsförmåga. Du bör dessutom ha en affärsmässig inställning, ett stort eget driv och gilla utmaningar.
   

  

 CGI är ett av världens största oberoende tjänsteföretag inom IT och affärsprocesser och vi har ett nära samarbete med SAP som Guldpartner. CGI har även blivit utsedda till SAP Partner Of The Year de senaste två åren och är en av de största SAP-leverantörerna på den svenska marknaden.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vad bra! Sök till tjänsten redan nu då vi rekryterar löpande.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Senior Treasury and Technology Consultant
description:
Zanders in Stockholm, Sweden is growing and expanding our team of experienced Treasury Consultants on various levels. Are you looking to elevate your career and to deliver performance that counts? If so, join our global financial consulting evolution!
   

  

**Your role** 
 :
   

  

 As Senior Consultant at our Treasury Advisory Group at Zanders, you will work alongside a wider team of international consultants on both local and international projects, for multinational companies. You will have a strong foundation in treasury or treasury technology and a desire to continue learning and growing. If you have an entrepreneurial mindset and want to contribute to the growing Zanders vision, this position is suitable for you.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Supporting treasury advisory projects, including assisting clients with establishing their target operating model, setting financial risk management strategies and optimizing their current treasury processes.
* Advising clients surrounding their treasury technology solutions. This could include re-defining current technology practices, defining the long term treasury technology roadmap, vendor selection and implementation of treasury technology solutions.
* Involved in managing treasury advisory projects, supporting decision-making and coaching of junior team members.
* Helping to identify new business/project opportunities, both locally and internationally. Playing a part in commercial activities such as presentations, RFP’s, events and networking.
* Pro-actively researching market/product developments. Actively seeking-out treasury technology advancements.
* Participating and hosting internal and external knowledge delegation sessions, such as treasury boot camps, guest lecture events and internal trainings.


**Skills to be successful:**
* Experience of 3-5 years' engagement in Corporate Treasury or Treasury Consulting.
* Relevant professional qualifications (Master's Degree, CFA, ACT, FRM, etc).
* Knowledge in Treasury Management, Treasury Management Systems, In-House Banking, Payments and Payment Factories, Bank Connectivity.
