* Preference for implementation knowledge of treasury management systems of vendors such as SAP, FIS, ION or others and other related tools such as SWIFT.
* Comfortable being actively involved in client work and willing to build a network of contacts.
* Familiarity with key day-to-day and month-end treasury operations and processes.
* Preference to work within an international environment.
* Fluent in Swedish and English; both written and spoken.


**We offer:**
* A hybrid work environment, that promotes a healthy work-life balance,
* Participation in the Zanders bonus scheme,
* Secure your future with a pension scheme,
* Zanders has taken out several insurances for the benefit of the employee
* 28 paid holiday days,
* A laptop and an iPhone,
* An entrepreneurial culture that values personal development, with ample room for initiatives,
* Expertise in your chosen field, building skills rapidly alongside diverse clients and consultants,
* A truly collegiate environment with enthusiastic and helpful colleagues, fostering career excellence in Treasury, Risk or Technology,
* An international and fun working environment, Cultural night events, annual Zanders's trip to a (surprise) location in Europe and many more exciting experiences to come!


**About Us:** 
 Progress your career with Zanders.
   

  

 We are a global financial consulting firm focused on Treasury, Risk and Technology. From our HQ in the Netherlands, we have been expanding our presence in Europe, UK, USA, and Asia. For 30 years we have been providing innovative solutions embracing the latest technological advancements to multinational corporations, financial institutions, public sector entities and NGOs. We go beyond conventional boundaries, delving into new market segments to uncover untapped opportunities. As pioneers in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) principles and practices, we support our clients to achieve their ESG goals.
   

  

 At Zanders we invest in our people for an inclusive atmosphere, where freedom, fun, and collaboration are pivotal and set us apart, defining our success. We believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion (DE&I) are essential to establish a strong and sustainable business, fostering a culture that values and respects diversity in all forms. Zanders is not just a workplace – it is a supportive community.
   

  

 We invite those who share our passion for collaboration, growth, and positive impact to join us on this journey. If you're in search of a workplace which nurtures personal and professional development, Zanders is the perfect fit for you.
   

  

 Join us as we continue to shape the future of consultancy, making a meaningful impact in the world of Treasury, Risk, and Technology!
   

  

*By applying for a role at Zanders, you give us approval to use and retain your personal details. Considering Zanders’ nature of enterprise, you are expected to behave to a high moral standard. A Pre-Employment Screening (PES) by a third party is part of the application process.*

title: Solution Architect - SuccessFactors
description:
*Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i att vidareutveckla och driva HR-system i en organisation med starkt fokus på tillväxt och innovation? Vi söker nu en engagerad och kunnig SuccessFactors Solution Architect till en viktig ledarroll i vårt framåtriktade interna IT-team!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som SuccessFactors Solution Architect kommer du att ha en central roll i vår interna IT-organisation och arbeta nära HR-funktionen. Du kommer att bidra till att optimera och utveckla vår gruppgemensamma SuccessFactors-lösning med ett holistiskt perspektiv. Rollen innebär att du kommer att delta i strategiska diskussioner kring HR-teknologins framtida utveckling och säkerställa att vi som organisation aktivt drar nytta av den senaste teknologin. Du kommer att ha breda kontaktytor och arbeta i en miljö som värdesätter innovation och förbättring.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Ansvara för den tekniska arkitekturen och driften av SuccessFactors
* Implementera och optimera processflöden och integrationer i SuccessFactors
* Vara kontaktperson och tekniskt stöd för HR och andra interna stakeholders
* Stötta och driva projekt för nyutveckling, implementering och uppgraderingar av SuccessFactors
* Utveckla integrationslösningar mot andra system (exempelvis ServiceNow eller lönesystem)
* Ansvara för konfiguration och implementation av ny funktionalitet
* Leda implementeringen av SuccessFactors cloud-releaser för att säkerställa att vi utnyttjar den senaste teknologin
* Ansvara för felsökning och problemlösning i SuccessFactors
* Säkerställa att systemet följer både interna och externa krav på säkerhet och regelefterlevnad


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Akademisk examen inom IT eller motsvarande
* God tidigare erfarenhet som Solution Architect (Functional Architect) eller motsvarande roll med djupgående kunskap inom en eller flera av marknadens större HCM-plattformar, t.ex. SAP SuccessFactors, Workday eller Oracle HCM Cloud
* Experterfarenhet av konfigurering och god kunskap om samtliga moduler inom SuccessFactors (t.ex. Employee Central, Performance and Goal Management, Learning Management, etc.)
* God förståelse för integrationer och datamodeller inom HR-systemlandskap
* Erfarenhet av att samarbeta med olika intressenter och förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett enkelt och pedagogiskt sätt
* Erfarenhet av IT-projektledning
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Certifieringar inom SuccessFactors
* Grundläggande förståelse för SAP’s integrationsplattform CPI
* Erfarenhet av IT-projektledning


 Som person har du en stark analytisk förmåga och kan se helheten i komplexa IT-system och HR-processer. Du är självständig och leveranssäker i ditt arbete med lätt för såväl reaktiv som proaktiv problemlösning. Ditt team lägger stort fokus på innovation och utveckling och vi ser därför gärna att du delar vårt intresse för att se möjligheter i varje process.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och senior roll i en organisation som värdesätter innovation och förbättring. Du får möjligheten att arbeta med de senaste HR-teknologierna i en miljö med starkt fokus på digitalisering. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och tillitsbaserad arbetsmiljö där din kompetens och erfarenhet gör skillnad, samt goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling och påverkan inom din roll.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-02**

title: Field Marketing Manager, Nordics (m/f/x) - Sweden based
description:
**Field Marketing Manager** 
**(m/f/x) - Sweden**
**Overview**
 Are you looking for a role with a creative, forward-thinking and innovative marketing team? This position is your opportunity to lead the advancement of AvePoint’s brand, demand and stand to increase company value.
   

  

**What will you be doing?**
 As a Marketing Manager, you will lead the development and execution of marketing plans for AvePoint’s business, in close collaboration with our sales teams and channel partners. This role will succeed on a deep understanding of demand generation, campaign management, field marketing, content creation, social media and channel marketing.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Serving as the go-to marketing lead for creating territory-specific, integrated marketing plans that help meet this territory’s sales objectives
* Driving sales enablement efforts in the field, helping sales teams drive their own demand and accelerate pipeline
* Developing and executing pipeline acceleration activities in support of quarterly and yearly metrics
* Representing regional needs during worldwide marketing program planning
* Developing and executing multi-touch, integrated demand generation campaigns targeting territory specific accounts
* Leveraging an integrated mix of social media, digital, physical & virtual events, content marketing, and other awareness-driving tactics to drive demand, awareness, and thought leadership


**OK, I'm interested... but is this really the job for me?**
 We look for people who value agility, passion and teamwork; those who can bring fresh ideas to the table and want the opportunity to learn, grow, and expand their careers. Bring your aptitude and build upon what you do best for our customers, partners, team, and you.
   

  

 For this role, you are someone with impressive relationship-building skills, and possess the ability to speak the language of the business, translating marketing metrics into business drivers that Sales cares about. This is a heavily influential role, so the ability to communicate clearly, persuasively, and assertively is a must.
   

  

 Other qualities you will need to be a fit for this role include:
   

  

* BA/BS degree
* +7 years in field marketing, channel marketing, demand generation, or digital marketing specifically in the B2B space
* +5 years of experience executing demand generation campaigns
* Marketing knowledge in the IT/Software space
* Experience in tracking and measuring marketing events, programs, and metrics
* Strong written and verbal communication skills – must be fluent in Swedish & English, any additional Scandinavian language is a plus
* Business savvy with an expertise of liaising with stakeholders to meet marketing objectives
* Organized and meticulous, with proven ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
* Very personable and professional demeanor


**About AvePoint**
 Check out our careers blog for content on our people, culture, and workplace!
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
   

  

 Any personal data you share with us during the application process will be processed strictly in compliance with applicable data protection laws and our Privacy Notice.

title: Environment, Health, and Safety (EHS) Operational Support Manager in Sweden & Finland - Stockholm
company_industry: Manufacturing, Dairy Product Manufacturing, and Food and Beverage Manufacturing
description:
Location
   

  

 Solna, SE
   

  

 Are you an upcoming dynamic leader passionate about Environment, Health and Safety (EHS)? Do you want to play a pivotal role in shaping and implementing Arla's EHS standards, driving us towards our ZERO loss vision? Arla has made significant progresses in transforming our EHS culture and we are now seeking an ambitious EHS Manager to lead our operations in Sweden & Finland. In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a difference without line manager responsibilities. Join us at our vibrant Stockholm office, reporting directly to the Global Environment, Health & Safety Director.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 As the EHS Manager, you will be the voice of EHS within Arla, ensuring equal visibility and importance alongside other business priorities. You will provide expert guidance aligned with our global QEHS agenda, developing local initiatives and participating in global efforts to reduce risks across EHS. Your mission will be to develop the organization's capabilities in terms of skills, knowledge, and behaviors. This will be achieved by providing EHS leadership and guidance to our Sweden & Finland Supply Chain. Support the organization in risk assessments, root cause investigations and corrective actions to prevent future occurrences. Assist in serious incident and accident management situations, including liaising with authorities. This is closely linked to supporting SE/FI QEHS Business Partner and operational teams in achieving compliance with internal and external standards. Enabling collaboration across the business to share EHS learnings and best practices. Please note that the role requires frequent traveling to all our sites in Sweden/Finland and occasionally to other countries.
   

  

 Your key responsibilities also includes
   

  

* Streamlining and harmonizing working methods for the Sweden and Finland organization in line with Arla's Integrated Management Systems
* Acting as the primary contact for relevant authorities, industries and certifying bodies regarding environmental matters
* Conduct EHS inspections where relevant to support standard compliance
* Monitoring and targeting EHS-related metrics and KPIs
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and changes in regulations to ensure continuous improvement for EHS practices.


**What Will Make You Successful**
 We see that you have an education within Environmental, Health & Safety. Ideally focused within the food industry. We believe you are newly graduated or have 1-2 years of work experience. Training and experience within project management is an advantage. As a person, you show integrity and have the ability to foster positive and collaborative relationships.
   

  

 Furthermore you are
   

  

* Eager to engage with stakeholders across FMCG operations, retailers and logistics
* Analytically skilled and have the ability to handle complexity at both operational and strategic levels
* Willing to travel +80 days per year within Sweden/Finland (there can be exemptions to other countries)


**What do we offer?**
 We’re committed to professional development and promoting from within. Our positive and collaborative culture will bring out the best in you. And you’ll join a market leader who produces nutritious household-favorite brands in a way that make things better for our customers, the farmers who own us and the whole world.
   

  

 Arla Foods has collective agreements, and we always ensure to offer good and competitive working conditions. In addition to that, safety and working environment are our top priorities, which is why we, among other things, conduct random drug and alcohol tests.
   

  

**Would you like to join us?**
 If you want to join us and help shape the industry, then seize this exciting opportunity and apply no later than 2025-03-09. Please send in your application in English. Please note that we will review applications on an ongoing bases and may close the recruitment before the last application date. For additional information, feel free to call Global EHS Director, Filip Rasmussen at +45 30373614 or contact Talent Acquisition Consultant, Louise Agerman at lagel@arlafoods.com.
   

  

**We have a purpose for Good**
 At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you?
   

  

***BEWARE! RECRUITMENT FRAUD***
*It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails and fake recruitment campaigns on the internet from people purporting to work for Arla Foods. Learn more via this* 
*link* 
*.*
 Ref.93374

title: Senior Product Designer, Stockholm
description:
We are looking for a friendly and ambitious Senior Product Designer to join one of our cross-functional product development teams.
   

  

 At Funnel, we emphasize team collaboration. Teams here are not handed predefined requirements, instead they identify opportunities and craft innovative solutions for their part of the product, all while taking responsibility for the holistic user experience. Learning is central to us, and we use both qualitative and quantitative methods to evaluate features and discover opportunities. We work with small iterations and deploy to production several times a day.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Product Designer you bring a deep empathy and understanding of our users' challenges, priorities and day-to-day. In the team, you’ll take ownership of delivering an exceptional user experience, working closely with a product manager and engineers to prioritize opportunities that enhance usability, delight our users, and drive business impact. We believe that the best collaboration and innovation happen when teams work together in the same space, and as such, we work from our office in central Stockholm as much as possible.
   

  

 At Funnel, you’ll have the opportunity to develop your craft, collaborate with a highly talented design function, and grow within a company that’s at the cutting edge of building great products.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We want you to thrive in your role and believe that you have:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience as a Senior Product Designer in close collaboration with product managers and engineers, with direct access to users
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to make the complex seem simple; both in writing, through prototypes and in-person
* Expertise in product discovery techniques like interviews, user testing, prototyping, scoping and rapid iteration
* An ability to clearly articulate design decisions and champion a high bar of usability in the team
* A wide portfolio of skills and techniques, knowing when pixel-perfect detail is needed, and when a quick sketch on a whiteboard gets the job done
* Expertise in Figma


**Bonus If You Also Have**
* An understanding or hands-on experience in performance marketing
* Experience from a fast-growing B2B SaaS company
* Hands-on experience using and/or building products used for data exploration and data visualization
* Experience and expertise with design systems
* Expertise in quantitative data analysis


**The Product**
 Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.
   

  

 All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.
   

  

 Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

**→ Take a look at our Funnel benefits**
**→ Watch our co-founder Pelle tell the story of Funnel**
**Other Information**
 This role is based in our Stockholm office. At Funnel, we embrace an office-first approach, working on-site at least four days a week. While we offer plenty of flexibility for life’s events, summer months, and holidays, we aim to avoid fixed remote workdays.
   

  

 We do not offer sponsorship or relocation for this position, and therefore we will take into consideration only applicants;
   

  

* Who is located in Stockholm
* Hold Swedish citizenship
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship
* Have a valid work permit for working in Sweden


 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Supply Chain Manager
company_industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Manufacturing, and Food and Beverage Services
description:
Vill du leda och utveckla varuförsörjningen i ett av Sveriges ledande bageriföretag?
   

  

 Lantmännen Unibake är en av Europas ledande bagerikoncerner och producerar bröd för både dagligvaruhandeln och foodservice. I Sverige driver vi tre produktionsanläggningar i Örebro, Mantorp och Huddinge, där vi bakar högkvalitativa produkter som hamburgerbröd, korvbröd, frukostbröd och bake-off-produkter. För att säkerställa en effektiv och hållbar distribution har vi även ett helautomatiserat fryslager i Örebro, som spelar en central roll i vår logistikverksamhet.
   

  

 Till Unibake Sverige söker vi nu efter en strategisk och nytänkande Supply Chain Manager som vill utveckla och optimera vår logistik- och planeringsorganisation för att säkerställa en effektiv och framtidssäkrad leveranskedja!
   

  

**Det här kommer du att göra**
 Som Supply Chain Manager leder du en organisation på cirka 30–35 medarbetare inom Warehouse & Logistics, Customer Service och S&OP & Planning. Du har fyra direktrapporterande medarbetare, varav tre chefer, och tillsammans ansvarar ni för att optimera hela leveranskedjan och driva kontinuerliga förbättringar för att skapa en effektiv, hållbar och affärsdriven logistikverksamhet.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att sätta strategier, mål och riktlinjer inom området samt utveckla arbetssätt, processer och verktyg för att optimera flöden och driva proaktiva förbättringar. Lagerhantering, hållbara transportlösningar och förstklassig kundservice är centrala fokusområden. Tillsammans med S&OP & Planning Manager äger och driver ni utvecklingen av vår S&OP-process, där din organisation säkerställer träffsäkra kommersiella beslut och skapar en kundorienterad leveranskedja. Du har dessutom budgetansvar.
   

  

 I din roll arbetar du nära sälj, marknad, finans och övriga funktioner inom operations för att säkerställa en integrerad och långsiktig strategi. Du representerar även Unibake Sverige i globala forum inom ditt område, där du bidrar med lokala insikter till koncernens strategiska beslut.
   

  

 Du rapporterar till Operations Director för Unibake Sverige och ingår i ledningsgruppen för operations. Rollen är placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm, med regelbundna resor till främst vår site i Örebro men även Mantorp och Huddinge.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Det här behöver du för att lyckas och trivas**
**Du Har**
* Erfarenhet av en ledande position inom Suppy Chain från en producerande verksamhet, gärna från en multi-site-organisation i en internationell miljö
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av personalansvar och att utveckla team
* Mycket goda färdigheter i IT-system (som exempelvis ERP, planeringssystem, Officepaketet, Power BI)
* Professionella språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift
* En relevant högskoleutbildning, exempelvis civilingenjör inom supply chain management eller motsvarande område


 Det är starkt meriterande om du har erfarenhet av automationslösningar, operations excellence och/eller Lean.
   

  

**Du Är**
* En coachande och inspirerande förändringsledare som skapar delaktighet och utveckling inom teamet.
* Organiserad och har en stark planeringsförmåga, som med trygghet fattar affärskritiska beslut.
* En skicklig relationsskapare som aktivt söker samarbete med olika funktioner och på olika nivåer i organisationen.
* Analytisk och lösningsorienterad, med en stark vilja att driva nytänkande förbättringar och skapa resultat i världsklass.


 Självklart delar du våra värderingar – Öppenhet, Helhetssyn, Handlingskraft – och vårt löfte om att ta ansvar från jord till bord.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 Lantmännen är en stor internationell koncern och har en unik bredd i vår verksamhet. Detta innebär att vi kan erbjuda utvecklingsmöjligheter med varierande inriktning för såväl specialister som generalister inom olika bolag och branscher i fler än 20 länder. Vi arbetar aktivt med intern rörlighet och vill bidra till att medarbetare utvecklas och känner engagemang varje dag.
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi hoppas det! Du ansöker till tjänsten online, gärna så snart som möjligt men senast den 9/3. I din ansökan har du möjlighet att addera ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil.
   

  

 För en mer objektiv och inkluderande rekryteringsprocess tar vi inte emot personligt brev utan ber dig istället att besvara urvalsfrågor som är relevanta för tjänsten. I rekryteringsprocessen ingår både psykometriska tester och kompetensbaserade intervjuer, med syfte att främja en rättvis utvärdering för alla kandidater. På Lantmännen är det viktigt att alla har lika möjligheter till anställning och utveckling i koncernen.
   

  

 Som slutkandidat kommer det att genomföras alkohol- och drogtest via vår leverantör för företagshälsovård samt en bakgrundskontroll via vår leverantör ToFindOut.
   

  

 Har du frågor gällande tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Malin Allard, Talent Acquisition Specialist, på malin.allard@lantmannen.com
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Key Leader | Stockholm Store
description:
**Requirements**
**Description & Requirements**
**Who We Are:**
 lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The Key Leader role is an essential part of the store leadership team, impacting salesfloor team members and guest (i.e., customer) experience every day. Key Leaders are responsible for leading by example and providing support to Educators, facilitating an outstanding guest experience in the store, and overseeing all operations of the retail floor. Key Leaders leverage key performance indicators and metrics to prioritize responsibilities while adapting to day-to-day business adjustments and challenges.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities Of The Job**
**Leadership and People Management**
* Support ongoing learning and development of team members by providing direct feedback, coaching, mentoring, and career path guidance, and addressing performance concerns.
* Provide team members recognition, gap assessment, and overall performance documentation to support and reinforce career and personal growth.
* Develop, maintain, and disseminate product and general company knowledge through appropriate communication channels.


**Guest (i.e., Customer) Experience**
* Provide salesfloor leadership to team members, including planning salesfloor coverage and making decisions to maintain efficiency and effectiveness of salesfloor operations.
* Support team members (e.g., leading by example or coaching) with ensuring a great guest experience that values guests’ time, including assessing guest needs, providing technical product educations, and supporting in-store transactions and omnichannel programs (e.g., buy online/pickup in store, phone sales, and ship from store options).
* Interact with and assess guests’ unique needs to provide customized, effective purchase and return solutions and support.
* Provide technical product education by articulating the value and benefit of the product.
* Resolve guest feedback and address guest concerns or escalations to make it “right” for guests.
* Move dynamically on the floor to assess and fulfill the needs of the business, team, and guests.


**Working With Others**
* Contribute to a respectful and inclusive team environment by welcoming and celebrating differences to ensure a supportive and engaging experience for all team members and guests.
* Establish supportive and productive relationships with all team members.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure optimal guest experience and support store operations.


**Operations**
* Review business data and metrics to evaluate progress toward goals and determine if adjustments are warranted.
* Open and close the store in accordance with the opening and closing checklists.
* Manage product presentation tasks (e.g., put items back in place, restock or add depleted items to the floor from inventory, destock or relocate items) according to company standards.
* Assign Educators cleaning tasks as needed throughout the shift to maintain the luxury environment of the store.
* Ensure team uses in-store technology to support store operations and provide positive guest experiences.
* Understand and adhere to people safety policies and procedures to maintain a safe work environment.
* Perform work in accordance with applicable policies, procedures, and laws or regulations.


**Budget Responsibility**
* Not Applicable


**People Management**
* Team lead role indirectly responsible for subset of store employees on the floor or as delegated by Store Manager


**Key Skills & Core Values You Bring**
* Inclusion & Diversity: Creates/supports an inclusive environment that values/celebrates differences
* Integrity/Honesty: Behaves in an honest, fair, and ethical manner
* Guest Experience: Enjoys working and connecting with, understanding, and helping guests
* Collaboration and Teamwork: Works productively with and supports others to achieve goals; seeks partnerships and diverse perspectives
* Leadership: Is able and desires to lead, influence, and inspire others; motivates, empowers, develops, and directs people as they work
* Candid Communication: Is willing to openly/constructively share concerns (i.e., straight talk)
* Decision Making: Uses logic and reasoning to evaluate alternatives and make effective, timely decisions


**Job Requirements**
**Eligibility**
* Must be legally authorized to work in the country in which the store is located
* Must be 18 years of age or older
* Must have proof of the Right to Work and evidence relating to associated local legislative requirements (EMEA only)
* Must have the ability to travel to assigned store with own transportation methods


**Availability**
* Willing to work a flexible schedule including evenings, weekends, and holidays


**Other Willingness Requirements**
* Willing to work as part of a team and also complete work independently
* Willing to move through a store for most of a shift to help guests and accomplish work
* Willing to move boxes weighing up to 30 lbs (13.6 kg)
* Willing to work in an environment with bright lights and loud music


**Experience**
* Work experience


**Job Assets (i.e., nice to have; not required)**
* Education: High school diploma, GED, or equivalent
* Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent
* Experience: 1 year of retail/sales leadership experience (supervisor or people management not necessary)


 In keeping with our mission, please connect with us at accommodations@lululemon.com if you have questions about how your unique abilities may translate to the requirements for this role, with or without a reasonable accommodation. In your email, please include the position title, the location of the position and the nature of your question or request.
   

  

**Beyond The Paycheck (Benefits & Perks)**
 At lululemon, we care for and invest in the whole person – body, mind, spirit. Our total rewards program is designed to support you in achieving your goals and focus on the things you love. In addition to competitive base pay and a team-based bonus program, we also offer extended health plans, paid time off, savings plans, generous employee discounts, fitness/yoga classes, parenthood top up program and personal and professional development programs.
   

  

 Note: availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to your location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these benefits and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

title: Head of Applied Generative AI
description:
Grow with us
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 Within BNEW RCE, the mission of the AI & Emerging Technologies unit is to be an incubator for SW technologies, Generative AI, Embedded AI and Data analytics. That is, we work with prototyping and technology foresight for the product roadmap in RCE, with a special emphasis on unlocking the potential of AI in RAN. In addition, we work cross BNEW R&D on network data, analytics and generative AI – both as distinct technology areas and to enable innovation. The SW Technology incubation mission covers a broad range of topics from fundamentals in computer science (i.e. compilers, programming languages etc) to cloud systems technology and digital twins.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 Reporting to the Head of AI and Emerging Technologies within RCE, and part of the unit’s leadership team, the Head of Applied Generative AI leads our research- and development team in that area. The mission is to build a strong Generative AI practice for BNEW, to secure both a major transformation of AI-assisted tooling for R&D (custom LLM’s, agentic RAG and more), as well as laying the foundation for generative models in future RAN products. Responsibility areas also include hyperscale cloud infrastructure to support the team, and technology partnering in the Generative AI area broadly.
   

  

**The skills you bring:**
* Strong domain experience in software development, preferably in AI systems engineering, RAN systemization or RAN hardware design
* 10+ years product development experience in leading development teams, with a demonstrated passion for innovation
* Experience leading supplier partnerships and technology scouting
* Experience driving transformation in R&D organizations
* Experience in Generative AI model development, including cloud infrastructure and data science
* Relevant tertiary qualification or commensurate working experience.
* Strategic and big picture thinking, with the ability to focus on delivering on your contribution to BNEW R&D today and into the future
* Thrives on accountability, overcoming challenges with a can-do attitude and motivated to achieve beyond expectations
* Collaborates by default and looks to work together rather than compete, also holding your teams accountable for working as one BNEW R&D
* Authentic, courageous and inspiring leadership with empathy and humanness, whilst building high performing teams and growing tomorrow’s leaders
* Fact-based and timely decisions, stepping forward to make tough decisions even when paradoxes are present, details lacking, or the stakes are high
* Customer-first mindset and proactively build this in your team.


**Last date to apply: 17th March 2025**
**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 762613
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 Versha Sharma (versha.sharma@ericsson.com)
   

  

 ]]>

title: Senior IT-supporttekniker
description:
**Vi letar efter nya stjärnor till vårt supportteam i Stockholm och vi hoppas att du vill vara med på vår spännande resa.** 
 🚀
   

  

 Vi på TechTrade International AB är IT-avdelningen/IT-stöd till ca 200 privata vårdgivare runt om i Sverige. Vi brinner för att effektivisera och utveckla vården i Sverige. Vårt bidrag till samhället är att skapa mer tid för vårdgivarna och sina patienter.
   

  

 Som IT-tekniker på TechTrade får du möjlighet att vara med och bygga vår nya support ”Support 2025” där kundupplevelsen står helt i centrum och där vi ska skapa bra rutiner och arbetssätt för att lösa våra kunders ärenden.
   

  

 TechTrade grundandes 1993 och är nu inne på en spännande tillväxtresa och hoppas att du vill vara med oss i denna process. Vårt huvudkontor ligger idag i fräscha lokaler i Kista, Stockholm. Vi har även ett kontor i Helsingborg.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Senior IT-Support tekniker kommer du både att hantera First line support och mer avancerade tekniska problem samt fungera som en expertresurs för både användare och dina First Line-support kollegor. Du arbetar med bland annat felsökning, administration och underhåll av IT-system och applikationer men du kommer även att hantera ärenden via telefon, e-post och vårt ärendehanteringssystem. Rollen kräver ett analytiskt förhållningssätt, god problemlösningsförmåga och en strukturerad arbetsstil.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Djupare felsökning av hårdvara, mjukvara och nätverksrelaterade problem
* Hantering av ärenden i vårt ärendehanteringssystem
* Administration av användarkonton och behörigheter i Microsoft 365 och andra system
* Installation, konfiguration och uppdatering av klient- och serversystem samt av datorer, skrivare och annan IT-utrustning
* Dokumentation av lösningar och processer för att förbättra supportflödet
* Samarbete med Operations och tredjepartsleverantörer för att lösa komplexa ärenden


**Kvalifikationer Och Egenskaper**
 Vi letar efter dig som har en naturlig fallenhet för att ge kvalitativ service. För att passa bra i tjänsten ser vi att du har en approach som präglas av en hög grad av kundfokus och service. Vidare är du fokuserad på att nå resultat och utvecklas över tid. Du är en person som samarbetar bra i grupp, men även med självständigt arbete. Du har ett eget driv och vill göra det lilla extra för våra kunder och teamet. Du är nyfiken och flexibel på att utvecklas då du kommer ta dig an en varierande mängd olika ärenden. Du är kommunikativ, samarbetsvillig och sprider positiv energi. Du har både förmågan att identifiera problem samt hitta lösningar till dessa.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av IT-support, felsökning och återkoppling
* Serviceinriktad och har god kommunikationsförmåga
* Har ett stort tekniskt intresse och erfarenhet av IT-support på en mer avancerad nivå
* Dokumenterade kunskaper i Windows 10 -och 11 miljö, Microsoft 365 och Active Directory
* Erfarenhet av felsökning inom nätverk, skrivare, klienter och applikationer
* Praktiska och teoretiska nätverkskunskaper WAN/LAN/WLAN
* Erfarenhet av Android och IOS
* Kunskaper inom Intune och/eller MDT
* Arbetar strukturerat, är noggrann och trivs med att dokumentera lösningar
* Är flytande i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* B-körkort
* Klara av krav för att arbeta med känslig information


**Meriterande**
* Gymnasieutbildning inom IT eller annan relevant IT utbildning
* Erfarenhet av Mac OS
* Erfarenhet inom eller mot vården
* Erfarenhet av TakeCare eller andra journalsystem eller vårdapplikationer


**Övrig information**
* Arbetet sker på plats i Kista, Stockholm
* Omfattning: 100%
* Start: Omgående


 Vi ser gärna att du som söker tjänsten i grunden har en data-/IT-/teknisk inriktning på gymnasiet eller annan teknisk utbildning. Vi tror att du är en person som har ett genuint intresse för support och har jobbat inom serviceyrket tidigare. Du är en person som tycker om att finnas till hands för kunden och för dina kollegor och som har service som prioritering i ditt arbete. Du kan på ett pedagogiskt sätt supporta och vägleda kunder via telefon och mejl.
   

  

**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö i ett teknikdrivet företag
* Möjligheter till utveckling och vidareutbildning inom IT-support och teknisk administration.
* Möjlighet att arbeta inom och lära dig flera olika tekniska områden
* Ett trevligt och samarbetsorienterat team där vi hjälps åt och lär av varandra
* Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner så som friskvårdsbidrag, individuell lönesättning, sociala aktiviteter som teamaktiveter, AW och fredagsfrukost


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vid ansökan så kommer vi göra en bakgrundskontroll på de sökanden.

title: People and Capability Leader - SAP Tech
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

* Do you see the potential in people and have a strong track record as a people manager?
* Do your clients and colleagues see you as an advisor where you always bring your best in leveraging SAP solutions to achieve business objective?


 If you’re motivated by playing a crucial role in growing our SAP Tech capability in the Nordics and further develop our people, please read on. You may be the one we’re looking for!
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 Capgemini are seeking a dynamic and experienced People Manager to lead the SAP Tech team in Stockholm. You will be a part of a Nordic capability team and the role will be combined with presales, delivery activities and people manager responsibility. As a leader you develop our SAP consultants within the tech domain to ensure that our people and business grow, and that we bring world class SAP Tech capabilities to our clients.
   

  

 In this role, you will play a key role in:
   

  

* Driving team performance through effective utilization management, performance evaluations, and competence development
* Leading, mentoring, and motivating a team of senior and junior SAP tech consultants to grow and deliver exceptional results
* Fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment, promoting open communication and knowledge sharing
* Being an advisor for our clients around SAP processes, identifying areas for improvement, and developing SAP solutions to address their specific needs
* Collaborating with sales and presales teams to develop winning strategies and deliver compelling proposals to clients
* Collaborating with project teams to ensure SAP solutions are integrated seamlessly with existing systems and business processes
* Executing on company strategy to drive business growth and expansion


**YOUR PROFILE**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in in related field
* A strong entrepreneurial spirit and thrive in building and developing our business
* Strong people leader skills with the ability to inspire and motivate both senior and junior team members
* Proven experience in SAP and in-depth knowledge in SAP S/4 HANA
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with clients and internal stakeholders
* Proven experience in successful end to end SAP implementations
* Fluency in English is a must; Swedish is a plus


 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

title: Internship
company_industry: Think Tanks, Technology, Information and Internet, and Food and Beverage Manufacturing
description:
**Join us in shaping a sustainable world free from plastic pollution!**
 At Grale, our vision is a world free from plastic pollution. Plastics, made from petroleum, remain in our environment for thousands of years! By 2050, oceans could have more plastic than fish. We’re on a mission to change that.
   

  

 🏆 Grale has been named the “
 **World’s Most Innovative Sustainability Startup** 
 ” among 1,400 companies globally!
   

  

 🥇 We also won the prestigious “
 **Global Tech Innovator** 
 " award, selected from 2,000 technology companies worldwide.
   

  

 We’re growing our team and looking for outstanding candidates to join us in our mission!
   

  

 Internship
   

  

 When doing an internship at PlasticFri, you’ll become an important part of our small, passionate team, where your contributions will truly make a difference. Working closely with us, you’ll help ensure efficient and scalable operations, playing a key role in driving our mission forward. This hands-on experience offers you the chance to be deeply involved in meaningful work, gaining valuable skills in a dynamic, purpose-driven startup. At Grale, every team member is essential, and you’ll have the opportunity to work on critical tasks that will help us grow and create real, positive impact.
   

  

**Responsibilities Include**
* Collaborating on key projects that align with our mission.
* Contributing ideas and solutions to further our goals.
* Supporting teams with tasks relevant to your area of expertise.
* Assisting in the development and execution of strategies.


**Ideal Candidate**
* Passionate about sustainability and environmental issues.
* Eager to learn, creative, and proactive.
* Strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written.
* Ability to work independently and manage deadlines effectively.
* Flexible and adaptable in a dynamic, startup environment.


**We Offer**
* Unique experience working with an award-winning sustainability startup.
* An opportunity to shape your role and grow with the company.
* Professional and personal development.
* The internship is unpaid & the period is generally 6 months, but it can be adapted based on your situation and performance.
* Possibility of employment after the internship.


**Interested?** 
 We are interviewing continuously and aim to fill positions as soon as possible. Apply today!

title: Supporttekniker
description:
Har du arbetat något/några år i en servicedesk, som onsite-tekniker eller IT-tekniker ? Vi på Nexer Infrastructure i Stockholm söker nu fler konsulter som är sugna på att fördjupa sina kunskaper samt utvecklas inom IT. Hos oss får chansen att arbeta hos välkända bolag i Stockholmsområdet.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Trygga anställningsvillkor och en fast månadslön
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter som konsult och en långsiktig plan hos Nexer
* En familjär atmosfär och teambuildingaktiviteter med dina Nexer-kollegor – senast var vi på en Åreresa tillsammans!


**Om tjänsten**
 Som konsult inom IT-support arbetar du brett inom IT och användarstöd, och mer specifikt mot ramverk och verktyg så som Active Directory, Windows OS, Microsoft 365, grundläggande nätverksteknologier och ärendehanteringssystem såsom ServiceNow med flera. De flesta uppdragen innebär att du hjälper någon av våra kunder med IT-support på klientsidan och supporterar internt anställda genom telefon, mail, chatt och ärendehanteringssystem. I vissa uppdrag kan även onsite-support förekomma samt hårdvarusupport för datorer, kringutrustning, skrivare och AV utrustning.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du**
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av arbete i servicedesk/first line support
* Motiveras av att lösa problem och lämna användaren med ett leende på läpparna
* Trivs i att bemöta människor och ge stöttning på ett pedagogiskt sätt
* Har obehindrade kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift


 Vi ser gärna att du är bekant med följande tekniker: Active Directory, Windows OS, Microsoft 365/Azure, Windows Remote Desktop, SCCM/Intune, arbete i ärendehanteringssystem samt grundläggande kunskap inom felsökning av nätverk. Det är också ett plus om du har supporterat Mac klienter tidigare.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult hos oss tror vi att du har god analytisk förmåga, tar initiativ och är ihärdig när det gäller felsökning och problemlösning. Vi tror även att du har god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta både individuellt och i grupp, eftersom du som konsult kan komma att arbeta i olika sammanhang.
   

  

**Mer o** 
**m Nexer Infrastructure**
 Nexer Infrastructure (vi hette då Sigma IT Tech) startade sin verksamhet 2018 och är specialister på en sak – talanger inom drift, support och IT-infrastruktur. Vi hjälper företag att växa och framtids säkra sin kompetens med hjälp av flexibla konsulttjänster. Bland våra kunder finns många välkända aktörer som är marknadsledande inom sina respektive branscher.
   

  

 Som IT- konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och vi är måna om att du ska trivas. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att upprätthålla den goda stämningen i vår grupp, bland annat genom gemensamma aktiviteter som föreläsningar, after works och gemensamma lunch träffar. Blir du konsult hos oss lyssnar vi till dig, dina behov och i vilken riktning du vill utvecklas.
   

  

  

  

**Ansökan** 
  

  

 Då urval sker löpande ser vi gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att läsa den!

title: Linuxspecialist
description:
***Vill du bidra med dina Linuxkunskaper på en myndighet där du gör verklig skillnad för Sveriges säkerhet?* 
*Då kan FOI vara din nya arbetsplats! Vi erbjuder ett arbetsliv i balans, en utvecklande arbetsmiljö och ett samhällsviktigt arbete!***
**Om tjänsten**
 Vi Söker Nu En Eller Flera Engagerade Och Kunniga Linuxspecialister Till Vårt Team Med Placering i Kista. Du Blir En Del Av En Dedikerad Linuxgrupp Där Vi Kompletterar Varandras Kompetenser Och Arbetar Nära Tillsammans i Det Dagliga Arbetet. I Arbetet Ingår
   

  

* Drift och underhåll av vår Linuxmiljö, med fokus på klienthantering
* Användarstöd och support där du hjälper användare att lösa tekniska utmaningar
* Vidareutveckling och optimering av system och processer
* Deltagande i olika projekt inom IT-infrastruktur och Linuxbaserade lösningar


**Om enheten**
 Du kommer att ingå IT-enheten som tillhör avdelningen Forskningsstöd. Läs gärna mer om vad avdelningen gör genom att klicka på länken: Forskningsstöd
   

  

  

**Har du den kompetensprofil vi behöver?**
**Krav**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* För tjänsten relevant utbildning eller relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig
* Gedigen erfarenhet och djup teknisk kompetens inom Linux
* God förståelse för systemadministration, felsökning och scripting
* Förmåga att uttrycka dig väl på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


 Som person är du serviceinriktad och lösningsorienterad. Du har god samarbetsförmåga, är prestigelös och kommunicerar bra och tydligt med såväl kollegor som interna kunder. Du är också självgående, tar ansvar för din uppgift, strukturerar ditt arbetssätt och driver dina processer vidare självständigt. Du drivs även av att fortsätta utveckla din specialkompetens inom Linux och samtidigt bidra till förbättringar i vår Linuxmiljö. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper!
   

  

  

**Meriterande**
**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en blandad IT-miljö med Linux, gärna med fokus på klienthantering
* Erfarenhet av automation och säkerhet
* Kunskap inom automatiserad konfigurationshantering och infrastrukturoptimering
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med moderna IT-driftverktyg och skalbara system
* Kunskaper inom angränsande teknikområden som FOI bedömer relevanta för tjänsten
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom försvarssektorn


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Totalförsvarets forskningsinstitut (FOI) är en statlig myndighet som bedriver världsledande forskning inom försvar och säkerhet till stöd för Sveriges militära och civila försvar. Vi erbjuder en unik arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att arbeta med det som är viktigt för totalförsvaret och hela samhället. Forskningen tillämpas både inom försvarsmyndigheter och hos civila aktörer och spelar en avgörande roll i att bygga en relevant och effektiv försvarsförmåga.
   

  

 Vi arbetar medvetet för en god arbetsmiljö med en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Utöver detta erbjuder vi en rad förmåner. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: https://www.foi.se/jobba-hos-oss.html
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

  

**Vill du vara med och söka svaren för en säkrare värld?**
 Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och personligt brev via ansökningsknappen senast den 16 mars!
   

  

 För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta sektionschef Daniel Åkerstedt. Fackliga företrädare är Fredrik Ringblom (Saco-S) och Jonas Svefors (OFR/S – ST) Samtliga nås på 08-555 030 00.
   

  

 Då anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före anställning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). Inför säkerhetsprövning efterfrågas vidimerade kopior på de utbildningar och tjänstgöringsintyg som är relevanta för tjänsten.
   

  

 FOI är en myndighet varmed inlämnade ansökningshandlingar blir allmän handling som på begäran kan lämnas ut till utomstående enligt offentlighets- och sekretesslagen.
   

  

 Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag undanbedes.

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**Who You'll Work With**
 You will work closely with 1-2 of our Senior Partners, providing dedicated support, proactively organizing and managing their complex workday and create close meaningful external relations.
   

  

 You will be in daily contact with national and international colleagues and clients, as well as planning internal and external events. You will work in a warm, caring, and fun work atmosphere in the center of Stockholm with highly motivated professionals as your colleagues.
   

  

 You will become part of a team of professional and dedicated Executive Assistants, who on a daily basis use each other for sparring, giving a helping hand when needed and cover as backup for each other.
   

  

**Your Impact**
 You will proactively manage your Partner’s calendar and travel arrangements, provide broad administrative support, manage incoming communications, and prioritize emails to help organize and leverage time effectively as well as driving ad hoc tasks of various size and complexity.
   

  

 Moreover, you will assist in preparing presentations and materials, ensuring that the material is complete and accurate. Therefore, it is a prerequisite that you have excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish.
   

  

**Your Qualifications and Skills**
* You have +2 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or from a similar fast-paced and high standard environment
* You have a customer-oriented mindset and approach your focus is on how to best support our Partners, clients and colleagues
* You are entrepreneurial, highly motivated, have great organizational skills, and you enjoy solving calendar scheduling as well as other administrative tasks
* You do not mind changes in schedules but rather enjoy working in a fast-paced and changing environment
* You are reliable, detail-oriented and can handle expenses and timesheets with accuracy and care
* You enjoy an environment with dynamic and caring colleagues, and feel socially confident
* You are a proactive self-starter with a positive can-do attitude
* You have excellent written and spoken communication skills in English and Swedish at native level
* You are comfortable with Microsoft Office tools and know how to use them
* You are working efficiently towards improvements and embrace challenges as opportunities for development

title: System Developer Mainframe to NCL Dev team | SEB Solna
description:
Do you want to play a key role and contribute to one of SEB's most unique modernization projects?
   

  

 Working as a system developer in the New Cash Ledger Dev team is a unique opportunity for you who want to develop as a system developer in a modern organization with a high rate of change.
   

  

**About the role:**
 In your role at Core Ledger and the NCL Dev team, you will enter a unique journey of change where you and the team together are responsible for building a completely new Ledger System for the Bank. As a system developer, you will have a key role in building the system from scratch and creating a stable and manageable solution based on the needs of the business.
   

  

 The project started up some years ago and is growing every year. The project currently consists of project managers, sub-project managers, requirements analysts, testers and system developers.
   

  

 We are one of the Bank's highest priority IT development projects.
   

  

 In the role of system developer, you will eventually work with the entire development chain such as analysis, design, coding, testing, as well as lifecycle management of our applications and work with support and service to our users.
   

  

 The system development team where you will be part currently consists of techlead, system developer, requirements analyst, tester and scrum master, but we need more people who want to be part of the journey. The team works closely with the other teams within the NCL project in an agile context. We have a strong focus on education and learning from each other, and a goal to build up a stable and efficient management organization with modern development tools in the long term.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Passion for IT in general and system development in mainframe environment in particular.
* Knowledge of Cobol, Db2, JCL, IDz, SEB C/S and CC.
* Constantly want to learn more and be curious and open to new methods and ways of working.
* Take on new tasks with a creative and curious attitude, and you value accuracy and structure in the execution of your tasks.
* You are a team player who values doing others well.


**What we offer:**
* A key role in one of SEB's most unique and important projects.
* Challenging work with great opportunities to develop and influence.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 31st of March 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Johan Öberg johan.oberg @seb.se.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here:** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Account Manager Sweden
company_industry: Computer Hardware Manufacturing, Software Development, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Description and Requirements**
**"At BMC trust is not just a word - it's a way of life!"**
 We are an award-winning, equal opportunity, culturally diverse, fun place to be. Giving back to the community drives us to be better every single day. Our work environment allows you to balance your priorities, because we know you will bring your best every day. We will champion your wins and shout them from the rooftops. Your peers will inspire, drive, support you, and make you laugh out loud!
   

  

 We help our customers free up time and space to become an Autonomous Digital Enterprise that conquers the opportunities ahead - and are relentless in the pursuit of innovation!
   

  

 BMC Software Sales Professionals have the power to transform entire organizations. With your high-energy, dedication, and passion you will focus on designing and executing a go-to-market strategy, delivering revenue growth and customer happiness. If you are looking for a company that gives you the freedom to expand your role, focuses highly on your professional development through continuous enablement, gives you an environment where you would feel happy to come to work, then BMC is the place to be.
   

  

 Join us as a Sales Account Manager! As a Sales Account Manager, you will own a territory where you will be positioning BMC’s Iconic and cutting-edge technologies into some of the most prestigious customers.
   

  

**Here is how, through this exciting role, you will contribute to BMC's and your own success:**
* Act as the main point of contact for your customers. Throughout the full sales cycle, you will be supported by top, talented, product specialized Account Managers, Solution & Value Engineers, as well as a full ecosystem dedicated to BMC’s main strategy: customer centricity.
* Be the business owner of your territory to increase our footprint, build larger deals, and help BMC remain in its well-deserved market leader position.
* Lead as a BMC brand ambassador, both internally and externally, and build trust and confidence with customers, partners, and colleagues through integrity and professionalism.
* As every BMC employee, you will be given the opportunity to learn, be included in global projects, challenge yourself, and be the innovator when it comes to solving everyday problems.


**To ensure you’re set up for success, you will bring the following skillset & experience:**
* You can embrace, live and breathe our BMC values every day!
* You will have worked effectively as a team member while also providing team-on-team leadership and orchestrating the internal and external resources needed to effectively manage the sales process
* You have previously demonstrated your ability to further develop your business as a trusted partner by an in-depth understanding of pipeline, business practices, industry trends, and competitive landscape.


**Our commitment to you!**
 BMC’s culture is built around its people. We have 6000+ brilliant minds working together across the globe. You won’t be known just by your employee number, but for your true authentic self. BMC lets you be YOU!
   

  

 If after reading the above, You’re unsure if you meet the qualifications of this role but are deeply excited about BMC and this team, we still encourage you to apply! We want to attract talents from diverse backgrounds and experience to ensure we face the world together with the best ideas!
   

  

 BMC is committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, age, sex, creed, color, religion, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy, disabled veteran or status as a protected veteran. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, visit the accommodation request page.
   

  

 < Back to search results
   

  

 BMC Software maintains a strict policy of not requesting any form of payment in exchange for employment opportunities, upholding a fair and ethical hiring process.

title: Marketing Communications Specialist
description:
**An Amazing Career Opportunity for a Marketing Communications Specialist!!**
**Location:** 
**Stockholm, Sweden/Prague, Czech Republic**
**Job ID: 35287**
 The Marketing Specialist will plan and execute integrated marketing campaigns for HID’s Authentication Business Unit within the Identity and Access Management (IAM) solutions sector. This role involves collaborating with HID’s corporate marketing teams to ensure successful execution in alignment with the BU business strategy. The Marketing Specialist will work closely with the digital engagement team, product marketing team, and sales across the Business Unit.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 HID powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely.
   

  

 We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4,500 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo
   

  

**Identity and Access Management Solutions (IAMS):**
 HID Global Identity and Access Management Solutions products protect more than 85 million user identities. At HID Global, we understand that no person, device, or workplace can go unprotected. This philosophy of Zero Trust drives us to create new advances in risk-based multi-factor authentication, leads us to secure user identities in converged access environments and drives the need to expand implementations with our industry-leading digital certificates and PKIaaS solution to manage them at scale.
   

  

**As our** 
**Marketing Communications Specialist** 
**, you’ll support HID’s success by:**
* Developing and executing multi-channel campaign strategies in collaboration with marketing communications, product marketing, digital engagement, and sales teams
* Reviewing and enhancing nurture and primary email campaigns to improve inbound engagement
* Coordinating events, tradeshows, and product launches with the corporate event team and product marketing team
* Analyzing performance of the integrated campaigns (both digital campaigns and events), including engagement metrics, lead quality, and pipeline generation, to increase ROI and quality opportunities
* Creating and managing new landing pages, social content, webinar presentations, videos, sales templates, and scripts
* Supporting webpage optimization and recommend keyword and copy improvements
* Contributing to quarterly and annual strategic campaign plans
* Handling daily administrative duties, including purchase order and invoice processing
* Managing daily lead data management and list imports as part of standard processes, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders
* Maintaining relationships with third-party vendors and external agencies


**Your Experience and Background include:**
* BA/BS degree in digital marketing, marketing, or marketing communications
* 2 to 4 years of related marketing experience
* Experience with marketing automation tools (e.g., Marketo), project management tools (e.g., Workfront), and budget management tools (e.g., Allocadia) is a plus
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to meet deadlines consistently
* Previous experience in the software or banking and financial services industry is a plus
* Willingness to travel (>10%)
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas and data clearly in written, presentation, and spoken formats to various audiences
* Experience in creating and implementing successful promotional campaign content, marketing emails, social content, search marketing, and webpages
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well with team members, product management, sales, and customers
* Strong project management skills with the ability to balance multiple priorities
* Enthusiastic about enhancing analytical skills and the ability to interpret campaign data
* Strong understanding and experience with different marketing channels relevant to a B2B business environment
* Ability to work independently and achieve aggressive program goals


**What we can offer you:**
* Competitive salary and rewards package
* Competitive benefits and annual leave offering, allowing for work-life balance
* A vibrant, welcoming & inclusive culture
* Extensive career development opportunities and resources to maximize your potential
* To be a part of a global organization that is pioneering the hardware, software and services that allow people to confidently navigate the physical and digital worlds


**Why apply?**
* Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise. We welcome an opportunity to meet you and learn about your unique talents, skills, and experiences. You don’t need to check all the boxes. If you have most of the skills and experience, we want you to apply
* Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive change. We are open to ideas, including flexible work arrangements, job sharing or part-time job seekers
* Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly. We want all our employees to be themselves, to feel appreciated and accepted


 HID is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that reflects the global communities we serve. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. Our goal is to create a workplace that empowers everyone to thrive and be their authentic selves, fostering an environment of mutual respect and inclusivity. If you have a disability and require assistance or accommodation to participate in the application process or to perform essential job functions, please contact accommodations-ext@hidglobal.com .
   

  

**We make it easier for people to get where they want to go!**
 On an average day, think of how many times you tap, twist, tag, push or swipe to get access, find information, connect with others or track something. HID technology is behind billions of interactions, in more than 100 countries. We help you create a verified, trusted identity that can get you where you need to go – without having to think about it.
   

  

 When you join our HID team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally. As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Global Graduate Program - Commercial
company_industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Manufacturing, and Food and Beverage Services
description:
The Global Graduate Program: 2 years that will shape your entire career. We have graduate positions for the Commercial track within Sales and Marketing open in the UK, Sweden, Norway, Estonia, Poland and Romania.
   

  

 Joining the Unibake Global Graduate Program marks the beginning of an exciting two-year journey filled with professional and personal experiences, growth, and opportunities. This program is thoughtfully designed to develop your functional commercial skills in a business environment while providing leadership challenges that prepare you for an impactful career.
   

  

 We seek the brightest talents, and in exchange, we are committed to guiding you toward a meaningful full-time role where you can make a difference. You'll play a vital part in our mission: "Towards billions of smiling tummies."
   

  

**Why join Unibake and our Global Graduate Program?**
 With over 30 large-scale bakeries across 20+ countries and sales in more than 60 markets worldwide, we are proud to be the second-largest bakery group in Europe. As a global leader in bake-off and fresh bakery products, we serve food retail and food service channels with a strong focus on quality and swift delivery. Our dedication to excellence has made us a trusted partner to some of the world’s largest food providers.
   

  

 Sustainability is not just a "buzz” word for us. We recently committed to the Science Based Targets initiative as part of our ‘Baking for a better World’ sustainability strategy. We are dedicated to ensuring the future of the planet and taking the necessary steps to reduce our carbon footprint, as well as providing healthier product choices, and finally to create better opportunities for people.
   

  

**What to expect from the Commercial track?**
 During the two-year program, you will undertake one-year rotations across various commercial functions such as sales, category management or marketing, gaining valuable experience and taking full responsibility for a range of tasks from day one!
   

  

 You will have the opportunity to contribute to delivering sales and profitable growth targets by driving and supporting marketing and commercial initiatives. Your responsibilities may include developing a deep understanding of customers and consumers to create and execute strategic initiatives that drive growth.
   

  

 You might also work with the Sales department, analyzing data to generate insights and providing recommendations to improve business activities.
   

  

 This Graduate Program offers a broad exposure to various commercial functional areas across different markets, empowering you to explore opportunities and kick-start your career with confidence.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**What will be your Graduate Program highlights?**
**International Two-year program** 
**:** 
 starting in your home country 1st year with an international rotation in your 2nd year will enable you to leave your global footprint in Unibake and build a strong network. After rotation, you will bring experience back to your home country or a new location and continue your career journey there.
   

  

**Career Development Plan** 
**:** 
 Individual development plan that will help to accelerate your career and prepare you for your future with us. Leader or an expert? It’s up to you – you're in the driver’s seat.
   

  

**Support Program and Network** 
**:** 
 A network of dedicated stakeholders will support and guide you throughout your journey, fostering both your personal and professional growth. Additionally, you'll become part of a vibrant community of Global Graduates across various tracks, as well as alumni, providing you with a strong network that spans the entire organization.
   

  

**Expertise to succeed in Commercial and beyond:** 
 You will learn from the best and be exposed to Marketing, Sales or Category Management areas to increase your knowledge and build relevant competencies. In addition, you will take part in quarterly global workshops with your fellow graduates with whom you will also do an international project focused on solving a global challenge.
   

  

**What You Need To Have**
* Fluent in Swedish (or any other Scandinavian languages) and English, with professional working proficiency in both languages.
* A truly international mindset, you must have lived abroad already, and you have the willingness to move geographically, both during and after the Graduate Program.
* A Master’s degree at above pass-rate (or a projection that you’ll achieve this), within Business Administration, Business Development, International Sales, Marketing or other relevant areas.
* Graduation within the last 2 years or expected graduation date before September 2025.
* Availability to start the program full time in September 2025.
* You must be living and able to work in the country where you are applying, including having potential work permits/visa.
* A personality that fits our values. You are open, have drive, are a curious learner, and see the bigger picture. A person ready to go the extra mile in the pursuit of an ambitious and rewarding career.
* Some relevant work or internship experience from a professional company will be an advantage.


**Sounds interesting?**
 Please apply through our recruitment system and make sure to add the following information:
   

  

* Make sure that you upload your resume, grade transcript and diploma in the application form.
* No cover letter is needed, just answer 3 questions in the application form and tell us more about you and your motivation to join the program.


 We will interview on an ongoing basis so please don’t hesitate to send your application. Your application must be completed in English and will be treated confidentially.
   

  

 If you are a more experienced candidate, you are very welcome to apply to other roles at Lantmännen Unibake via our careers page.

title: Programmatic Manager
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.*
*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as* 
*P&G, Disney, H&M, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, LEGO, Spotify, Perrigo, Renault and many more.*
*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
 The Programmatic Manager will support the Head of Programmatic and oversee all aspects of programmatic campaign implementation. Key responsibilities include account management with stakeholders such as planners and clients, identifying new opportunities, and communicating effectively. Our programmatic team is currently based in both Stockholm and Malmö, but this position is located in Stockholm.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Campaign Management**
